intro: Glomera affinis, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are hairy and upright. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
